body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.
A summary of reviews will appear here.
<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#27084](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27084) (ci: A few fixes of `ccache` issues by hebasto)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
You will probably need to do the same for fuzz asan?
Also, need to edit Cirrus CI to do the same

> You will probably need to do the same for fuzz asan?

Will add.

> Also, need to edit Cirrus CI to do the same

Can we even do this for native_asan given there is no 2304-lto image listed here: https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/images/os-details#ubuntu_lts ?
native_fuzz split into #27363, as that is not blocked up upstream image issues/decisions.

I haven't tried to reproduce the original issue, since I don't have an aarch64 machine, but this works for me on Ubuntu 22.10 with AMD Ryzen 7950X, Docker version 23.0.2:

```sh
MAKEJOBS="-j32" CCACHE_SIZE=1G FILE_ENV="ci/test/00_setup_env_native_asan.sh" ./ci/test_run_all.sh
```

You can drop this after diff:


```diff
diff --git a/.cirrus.yml b/.cirrus.yml
index 237572f2e4..8abe2ba79b 100644
--- a/.cirrus.yml
+++ b/.cirrus.yml
@@ -261,7 +261,7 @@ task:
   # Images can be found here: https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/images/os-details
   compute_engine_instance:
     image_project: ubuntu-os-cloud
-    image: family/ubuntu-2204-lts # when upgrading, check if we can drop "ADD_UNTRUSTED_BPFCC_PPA"
+    image: family/ubuntu-2304 # when upgrading, check if we can drop "ADD_UNTRUSTED_BPFCC_PPA"
     cpu: 4
     memory: 12G
   env:
I guess google will push the image on April 25th or so. It should be fine for you to make all changes now and then click re-run in April, and mark as draft in the meantime.
diff_hunk:
@@ -261,7 +261,7 @@ task:
   # Images can be found here: https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/images/os-details
   compute_engine_instance:
     image_project: ubuntu-os-cloud
-    image: family/ubuntu-2204-lts # when upgrading, check if we can drop "ADD_UNTRUSTED_BPFCC_PPA"
+    image: family/ubuntu-2304 # when upgrading, check if we can drop "ADD_UNTRUSTED_BPFCC_PPA"

body: I wonder if we should split the tracepoints stuff into it's own CI, so it's not a blocker for other unrelated tests.

body: Not sure if this is worth it. I am not aware of anyone running the CI on aarch64 other than you. So it should be fine for you to locally apply this patch in the meantime (for less than a month)

body: Yep, will leave this as-is for now, and hopefully we can undraft on April 20th.

body: Lunar should be released on the 20th, https://discourse.ubuntu.com/t/lunar-lobster-release-schedule/27284, and hopefully the Gioogle Cloud images will be available shortly after that.

Can you check if 
```suggestion
    image: family/ubuntu-2210
```

exists? Just to make sure the naming scheme is correct?

body:
You can check for available images in ubuntu project like this:

```console
gcloud compute images list --project ubuntu-os-cloud --no-standard-images

NAME                                         PROJECT          FAMILY                         DEPRECATED  STATUS
ubuntu-1804-bionic-arm64-v20230418           ubuntu-os-cloud  ubuntu-1804-lts-arm64                      READY
ubuntu-1804-bionic-v20230418                 ubuntu-os-cloud  ubuntu-1804-lts                            READY
ubuntu-2004-focal-arm64-v20230302            ubuntu-os-cloud  ubuntu-2004-lts-arm64                      READY
ubuntu-2004-focal-v20230302                  ubuntu-os-cloud  ubuntu-2004-lts                            READY
ubuntu-2204-jammy-arm64-v20230421            ubuntu-os-cloud  ubuntu-2204-lts-arm64                      READY
ubuntu-2204-jammy-v20230421                  ubuntu-os-cloud  ubuntu-2204-lts                            READY
ubuntu-2210-kinetic-amd64-v20230125          ubuntu-os-cloud  ubuntu-2210-amd64                          READY
ubuntu-2210-kinetic-arm64-v20230125          ubuntu-os-cloud  ubuntu-2210-arm64                          READY
ubuntu-2304-lunar-amd64-v20230420            ubuntu-os-cloud  ubuntu-2304-amd64                          READY
ubuntu-2304-lunar-arm64-v20230420            ubuntu-os-cloud  ubuntu-2304-arm64                          READY
ubuntu-minimal-1804-bionic-arm64-v20230329   ubuntu-os-cloud  ubuntu-minimal-1804-lts-arm64              READY
ubuntu-minimal-1804-bionic-v20230329         ubuntu-os-cloud  ubuntu-minimal-1804-lts                    READY
ubuntu-minimal-2004-focal-arm64-v20230303    ubuntu-os-cloud  ubuntu-minimal-2004-lts-arm64              READY
ubuntu-minimal-2004-focal-arm64-v20230420    ubuntu-os-cloud  ubuntu-minimal-2004-lts-arm64              READY
ubuntu-minimal-2004-focal-v20230303          ubuntu-os-cloud  ubuntu-minimal-2004-lts                    READY
ubuntu-minimal-2204-jammy-arm64-v20230420    ubuntu-os-cloud  ubuntu-minimal-2204-lts-arm64              READY
ubuntu-minimal-2204-jammy-v20230420          ubuntu-os-cloud  ubuntu-minimal-2204-lts                    READY
ubuntu-minimal-2210-kinetic-amd64-v20230417  ubuntu-os-cloud  ubuntu-minimal-2210-amd64                  READY
ubuntu-minimal-2210-kinetic-arm64-v20230417  ubuntu-os-cloud  ubuntu-minimal-2210-arm64                  READY
ubuntu-minimal-2304-lunar-amd64-v20230420    ubuntu-os-cloud  ubuntu-minimal-2304-amd64                  READY
ubuntu-minimal-2304-lunar-arm64-v20230420    ubuntu-os-cloud  ubuntu-minimal-2304-arm64                  READY
```

Seem you need to use `family/ubuntu-2210-amd64`.
